Reviews.Title: “Visited Amsterdam and the Jupiter Hotel in April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Ian D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately good value for money, clean, well presented with a good selection for the continental breakfast. It is situated in a quiet part of the city with excellent tram links. We stayed on the fourth floor using a shared bathroom which was cleaned on a regular basis and had a shower that was easy to use. If we were to return to Amsterdam which we hope to do, we would definately book this again. The only small criticism was that there were no tea/coffee facilities in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for two nights”
Reviews.Author: Bogdan D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for two nights. The location is really nice - you can reach everything you need in reasonable times, rooms are really small and staircases are deliberately steep. So, you really need to climb in order to reach your room. Breakfast is really good and you can eat as much sandwiches and cookies and drink juice and milk and coffee as you want. Another thing is that if you stay in this hotel you will hear everything that happens around you in the closest rooms. Also there is nobody usually at the reception. Anyway the ratio quality/price is rather high, not because of very high quality, but because of low price.

Reviews.Title: “clean but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: karen g
Reviews.Content: the room was very clean and the receptionist was very helpful. its non smoking which is a bit of a pain but receptionist gave us a ground floor room so we would have easy access to go out and smoke. found other staff to be rude and obnoxious. tram is 4 min's away as is nearest coffee shop. all valuables were secure and found it perfect for a couple. breakfast finished at 10am which i feel is a bit early. all in all very clean, secure and one member of staff very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family City Break.”
Reviews.Author: 888Claire
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is perfect for a short family city break . The family room was spotlessly clean as was the ensuite bathroom , which looked brand new. The Hotel staff , who seem to get very bad press , were helpful, pleasant and informative. Breakfast was plentiful and more than adequate .The hotel is in an ideal location , with numerous bars and restaurants a mere 5 minutes walk away , with the city centre a further 5 mins walk . Overall I would recommend The Jupiter .

Reviews.Title: “There must be better hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Del419
Reviews.Content: Good things. It was clean. The en-suite bathroom looked to be a new refurbishment with good quality fittings. The breakfast was OK, nothing special but adequate. Good location, quite near Leidseplein. Not so good things. The owner was incredibly rude and has no idea of what constitutes good customer service. The first night we had to settle for a twin room despite booking a double. The day before we left I asked him "what was the easiest way to get to Anne Frank house.?" He replied "you haven't paid yet" I said I wasn't checking out until tomorrow and he said I should've paid when I checked in. No one told me or asked for payment at check-in. When I offered him my credit card (which my confirmation clearly said was acceptable in this hotel) he shoved it back at me saying "Cash". As I didn't have 390 euros in cash I explained to him he'd have to wait. Fortunately I found an ATM which gave me enough to pay him cash. The room only had one useless pillow per person, I asked for another two pillows but unsurprisingly didn't get them. On checking out the owner grilled us as to the whereabouts of the TV remote control which we'd left where we found it, in the room. At 130 euros a night I'd expect the owner to be civil.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: leitandi
Reviews.Content: The family room was maybe not big but adequate. It was bright and warm.The bathroom was fine and plenty of drawers for our stuff. It was great to get good breakfast. Yes, the elevator is tiny and the hallways narrow but this is the Netherlands. The location is about 5 minutes walk from Leidsplein and public transportation is easy. The neighbourhood is fairly quiet although ambulances and police cars are unusually loud. We had a problem with the smell in the bathroom and despite the staff's effort it was still bad when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Rude man”
Reviews.Author: buket2101
Reviews.Content: The room and location was good for the price which included a good breakfast, however the guy at recpetion was rude and tad creepy sometimes. One time we were in out room and he opened up the door for no reason at all then just closed it random

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug17
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay at this hotel. It was located a bit away from the city centre, but close to the museum district, a major park (Vondelpark) and some other tourist attractions (Heineken brewery). We rented bicycles and found our way to the hotel from Central Station. The lady who greeted us at check in was very pleasant and helpful. There is a lift in the building to get to the upper floors but it is TINY! Could just fit the two of us and our luggage. Our room was clean and tastefully decorated. It was also comfortably roomy and bright (thanks in part to the oversized window). The washroom/shower (shared) was located on each floor. Ours was very clean and modern. The breakfast buffet offered a good selection of items and was good. I would recommend this hotel to those travellers who are seeking a more quiet place vs. those found in the popular areas of the city with all the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff, but rooms”
Reviews.Author: theambassador97100
Reviews.Content: A few critics before mine, a person mentioned this was like the hotel of Psycho film... and it was true. This hotel is extremely well located, and the price is right for what you get. But the staff is quite horrible. When I arrived it was raining, and it was a cold day. I tried to check inn and I was received for this awful guy in the reception desk, who ask for my passport and my booking number. When he did he asked me to pay in advance for the room. I showed him my dutch credit card, and he mentioned they received cash only. I was surprised because I wasn't notified by this situation when I booked. He told me I had only 10 minutes to pay because there was a waiting list. I offered to pay for 2 nights in advanced because I didn't carry with me all that money and It was raining and that as soon the rain stopped I could go for the money. And he didn't accept my offering. It was all or nothing. So I walked 4 blocks to withdraw the money, at night, with a heavy rain and 4 blocks again to return. But that's not all, this guy was not alone, the rest of his ugly family was there.... The basic rooms for one persons, are quite small, like 6 steps long and 4 width. They are clean, with a nice view of the street. The room can be considered the best part, it is clean, and brand new. It has a hairdryer machine, and a shower cabin. The room also has a small chair, and a tabl that can be used as a desk. The bed is small, it is small than a personal bed. However this bed size is quite common in europe. There is a small breakfast offered between 7.30 and 9.30, but beware, if you arrived late, they won't allowed you to take anything, and it is forbidden to take a piece of bread with you to your room. The breakfast has some yogurt, bread, marmalade, milk, some apples and coffee. The hotel is well located, it is at 5 minutes walking to laidsesplain, Rembrantdplein, the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. There is a tram stop at 4 blocks that takes you to central station. This hotel is run by a family, they lived in the same building, so I could see the father, the mother, and another female person I couldn't identified. All of them are walking through the hotel making recommendations to the guests. For example, don't make noise when walking, or when going through the stairs... well how it is possible not to make noise if the stairs are made of wood? All the doors are noisy, but the administrator will ask you not to. When having breakfast, the father will be behind you counting how many pieces of bread you take, or the marmalade you grab, they are always watching. The only friendly person is the dutch woman who clean the tables. My conclusion: If you are traveling for many days don't stay here to long, o it if you need to do something in the area, nothing else. The staff is ugly, all this family who runs the hotel is rude, disorganized and bad motivated. This family business could be better if they stop administering the hotel and they let other friendly person starts administering. They are a completely mess. It is us who pay for a room, It is not them who are making us a favor.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to city perfect to get away from unwelcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Drelaxer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect walking distance from the city.. The rooms are very clean but are just plain rooms not somewhere you would be planning to spend alot of time.. The man on reception when we arrived was so unwelcoming.. You could tell he did not want us there.. Felt same way for 4 days and then on our departure day they came into the room at 10am when we were sleeping woke us up and told us that we have to be out for 11am no later.. We already knew this but we felt like we gave our money to nasty people.. I am writing this just so I can express how much you should not go here.. There are alot of nicer places and these people do not deserve the business

Reviews.Title: “no refund”
Reviews.Author: Paton61
Reviews.Content: Booked though easytobook.com and then cancelled weeks in advance only to be charged anyhow. and they still won't refund. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: DMarchesi
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Jupiter because of the price and Internet pictures. I felt the owner couldn't have been of any more help than he was. My husband had his wallet stollen as we got off the tram on the way to the hotel. All our cash was gone. The owner let us check in (the banks had closed for the day and they take cash only), told us where the nearest bank was located and gave us a great referral to a local restaurant down the street.. He answered all the questions I had about restaurants, sites, local habits, etc. and I had some every day. The included breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs, cold cereals, fruit, cheeses, meats, breads, juices, milk and coffee. Enough variety for the three days we stayed there. The room just had enough room around the bed to get in and out and the bathroom was snug, but everything was clean. As for the owner's personality, at first he was guarded and cold, but the more we talked to him, the more he loosened up to us. I would definitely return to Hotel Jupiter!

Reviews.Title: “Stale, falling apart, dirty carpet but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: doctortoffee
Reviews.Content: Just needed a place to stay for a night and suppose its ok if you just need a bed. But the carpet was stained and dirty, there were weird stains on the walls and a huge burn mark on the single shelf above the bed, which was hanging loosely I might add. The shower was spotless which was excellent, but parts of the shower hose was missing and the water pressure and heat were not high enough. I stayed in winter and tHe heater did not work and there was a stale smell in the room the entire time. The stairs are AWFUL - narrow and steep and quite frankly dangerous when hauling luggage up and down (there's no elevator), and the handrail is loose at the top of the stairs. Best to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will stay here again on our next viisit”
Reviews.Author: sharonscottishlass
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area, about 15 mins walk from Dam Square, which makes things slightly cheaper. Hotel is clean, breakfast is okay,just the usual Dutch continental. In a quiet area,just a few minutes walk from Leidseplein Square. Can't say enough about how happy we were with this hotel and it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: randomadvisor
Reviews.Content: Please ignore the bad reviews about this hotel. I have stayed here twice before and am going to stay there again this year. Rooms are clean, beds are comfy and the location right next to the liedesplein is superb. staff were helpful and friendly on both occasions and the breakfast included is very good. a selection of breads,cereals,cheeses and cold meats along with some cakes NICE!!!. Good value for money overall and the hotel now has free wifi. On my last visit all the en suite shower rooms had just been done up. Overall i can recommend this hotel compared to some of the horror storys you see closer to central station. This hotel is in a nice peaceful location. enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: irishbloke2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a bank holiday weekend and have to say the hotel was far better than many of the reviews would suggest. Location was great ,a stones trow away from the Leidesplien , The room was clean. The breakfast was plentiful and overall considered it good value. The man on reception doesn't deserve the negative comments, we found him and his staff friendly and very helpful with maps and tourist info etc. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The only good comments must be from the owner trying to improve rating”
Reviews.Author: DrDector
Reviews.Content: The owner is the most rude person I have met for a while. He literally almost kicked us out at 11:45. The place is old, poorly maintained, noisy and dirty. I would go as far as to say that the hotel is a risk hazard : crack everywhere, dangerous stairs. The owner seems to have a couple of better rooms for a lucky few. Trust me, DON'T STAY

Reviews.Title: “No problem, I donÂ´t understand all negative comments”
Reviews.Author: marek_from_brno
Reviews.Content: We were prepared for the worse after reading all these negative comments, but in reality it was without a problem. Well, one problem was bad doors to our room, but we asked at the reception and they offered us another room without hesitation. Room was clean, TV worked well, wi-fi was working, elevator. Breakfast was OK. Location very good - close to the center by walk. As I said, I donÂ´t understand all very negative comments.

Reviews.Title: “dont do it !!”
Reviews.Author: pembas
Reviews.Content: its a complete dive- the owner (Hans we called him as he didnt introduce himself) is a miserable,arrogant & rude to55er who thinks of his guests as an inconvience. You couldnt call it bad service as there was NO SERVICE ! The rooms are dirty & Anne Frank would have had more room than what we had. DO NOT STAY HERE AND LINE THE OWNERS POCKET !!

Reviews.Title: “I strongly do not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Margoto
Reviews.Content: USE SAVE BOX AND BE CAREFUL ABOUT YOUR LUGGAGE. In addition our double-bed room on the fourth floor was extremely narrow. The walls were so thin that one could hear the noise from neighboring rooms. The TV did not work. no soap in the bathroom. The place looked more like a HOSTEL than a hotel. This hotel owner behaves rudely and arrogantly. Location and breakfast were ok.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: aileenwuornos89
Reviews.Content: Staff were incredibly rude, arrived half an hour early before check in and they would not let me check in or leave my belongings there..I had to carry them around Amsterdam at 9.30am for half an hour so they could decide to still let me check in half an hour late. The room I was in was not even cleaned properly and the cleaning man kept banging on my door demanding to be let in to clean the room. This should have been done before I was there. The shower had black mold growing all over the floor and ceiling, the lock in the room did not even work and there was no key given to the safe. I asked several times for the international dialing code so I could contact relatives and let them know I arrived safely and each time they just told me to enter the number. There was never anyone on the front desk and they did not seem happy that a young adult female was travelling by herself, even though it was none of their business. The manager also accused me of lying to him and called my several unkind things when I decided to check out and go to a better hotel even though I had complained about the state of the hotel and condition of my room several times. I would not stay here if I was running away from an axe murderer. Avoid at ALL costs.

Reviews.Title: “staff and manager extremely ignorant and rude”
Reviews.Author: austin12
Reviews.Content: walk in with no hello or greeting and find yourself very intimidated, thats what you get when you walk into this hotel. the manager had some serious issues which he takes out on his customers when dishing out the rules. the stairs are so steep the rooms nothing special. didnt eat out the hotel as it doesnt look the most hygenic. overall i would not recommend this hotel and feel it is not worthy of the title hotel in my opinion hostel would be a better title as it is extremely small and the walls are very thin.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere for friendly service”
Reviews.Author: katiekun11
Reviews.Content: Checked in and found Basil Fawlty without the humour. No welcome smile, no apology for only one room being ready. Steep stairs to first floor and no lift. Single room very small, just adequate but TV didn't work. Inadequate sound proofing so expect to be woken by late arrivals. Breakfast ok. Manager/owner does not seem to like his job but give him a chance and he will smile!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl_30
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel even though it was very close to the City Center (Entertainment Area). We checked in around four in the afternoon and the manager / receptionist was no where to be found and the reception are was locked. It took him about five minutes to show up and once he did he did not apologize that he was out. A note on the door would have been nice if he had been showing others to their room. He was not very friendly neither. The room was very filthy, I don't think the carpets have been cleaned in months or years. Our room had a water closet, but it smelled of urine. There were four of us staying in a room and were not very helpful when we asked for more towels since they would only give us two.

Reviews.Title: “Jupiter Hotel is not a recommended place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetno1
Reviews.Content: Very Bad Hotel (Not recommended) Jupiter Hotel in Amsterdam is the worst place to stay for even the shortest of breaks!! I strongly do not recommend this hotel. This hotel is not worth the price. The owner/ receptionist was very unhelpful and looked as though he found it very belittling when anything was asked from him including directions. This infamous guy at the front desk owner/ receptionist was very unpleasant, though the woman who works there was lovely. He barked when a couple came down late for breakfast and barked at us for when we received a call from abroad. However, he forgot to mention how rude HE was to the other person calling and wanting to leave a message for us. It's definatley in his nature to be a complete A55hole and upset the guests staying there. Only time he smiled was when we were checking out and the lump sum going into his back pocket. Depsite it being in walking distance to the centre, I would not recommend anyone staying here. For better price you can go elsewhere nearby, with better breakfast and where you'll find the host to be most hospitable and be willing to assist you so you come back and stay with them again. Jupiter Hotel is not a recommended place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “given the reviews surprisingly ok”
Reviews.Author: DublinBrianer
Reviews.Content: felt this hotel was ok for price, room very small (Amsterdam!) safekeeping in room, room clean, shared facility with one other room ok ( I was in room6), would not describe the famous owner as rude but more of a distant nture, however found him quite pleasant, breakfast adequate, no real complaints given the price and the excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Never ever go to Jupiter in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Reza1352
Reviews.Content: The staff are sooooooooooooooooo rude. The rooms are small, dirty and uncomfotable. Staff do not care at all your concern. I will never ever go to Jupiter again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel owner from Hell”
Reviews.Author: FifeBatman
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my wife and I had been to Amsterdam so we were really looking forward to it.We arrived at the hotel on Sunday evening but not particularly late.Nevertheless.the door was locked with no note or explanation.Someone else arrived at the same time and was as confused as us.After quite a long and anxious wait this grim-faced guy pushed his way past without a word,unlocked the door and minus apology started demanding names etc.I was completely dumbfounded.I had always been told how welcoming and friendly Dutch people were. This guy though turned out to be the exception.Why he chose to run a hotel I`ll never know.He obviously hates people.He seems to care more about the impression his hotel creates[fancy floral decorations at breakfast etc.] than being courteous and helpful.Although the position of the hotel and the standard of accommodation are reasonable I found the appalling attitude of this hotelier and his wife completely nagated any positive aspects and would STRONGLY advise anyone wanting a favourable impression of Amsterdam to steer well clear of the Hotel Jupiter.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Hotel (Not recommended)”
Reviews.Author: rajesh784
Reviews.Content: Very Bad Hotel (Not recommended) I strongly do not recommend this hotel. This hotel is not worth the price. When you go for reservation, they will promise you the lot of things (so that you checkin) that they do not deliver. In general, they promise you the following: 1. Unlimited drop to the market through car (But they always have some excuse that traffic jam is there in market, so car cannot come OR it will take 45 minutes for the car to come whereas you can walk in 20 minutes. We stayed for three days and this chap never provided with any car. They always had a new excuse ready) 2. They will try to get you into package deal like 7500 for stay, food and traveling. This way you end up pay more (approx 2000 rupees per day) as for the sight seeing for 3 days you can get the car dedicated for yourself. This hotel staff will put 3 couples in one car, so you go out and in as per their timings and rules. Do not go for the package deal with this hotel. It would turn out to be very expensive. For only stay (without food / touring) hotel is good. 3. They will tell you that your breakfast would be served in room and they will never serve you there. When you will call the room service, they will keep on saying that waiter has gone to your room and he will be there in another 5 minutes, but waiter will never turn up. 4. Also for dinner, you need to reach the restaurant precisely at 8:30 PM or there would be no seating available and in next lot, the food would have gone cold that of course one does not enjoy. 5. Never ever book any bus from this hotel. They will tell you about excellent bus and will provide the most cheap and dirty bus in the town. They charged us for super deluxe bus and provided the bus in which seats were broken. There were no shockers in the bus and some people (drunk) were lying in the passage of the bus. It was nightmare traveling from manali to Delhi. For your information, MUKUL BUS SERVICE is the third class bus service. They charge you high and provide the low quality, dirty buses. Summary: Use this hotel just for stay. Avoid booking for bus, touring, food, taxi, cars etc. from this hotel. Managers are not at all helpful. They are best at giving you different explanations all the time and even ignore you some times.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: sophiezo
Reviews.Content: The single room was the size of a cell. It was fine for one person who was mostly there to sleep and it was fairly quiet. The room and bathroom were clean. I wondered who designed the small bathroom sink because you couldn't do anything without splashing water onto the floor. The infamous guy at the front desk was unpleasant, though the woman who works there is lovely. He barked at me when I came down late for breakfast when I forgot about the time change. However, he smiled at me when I checked out. The breakfast is typical Dutch fare and is nicely laid out in a dining area that looks out onto a garden. Aside from that, there is no communal area that one can feel welcome to linger in. The reception area closes early in the evening and guests are given access to a side entrance. As a solo female traveler, I have one big gripe. There was a maintenance employee who became too friendly and then started coming on to me. (The staff comes to clean at 9:00, so don't think you'll sleep in.) This was difficult to deal with, especially when I was battling jet lag. Just because a woman's traveling solo doesn't make her sexual prey. I now regret that I didn't make a complaint. I wonder if anything would have been done.

Reviews.Title: “Jupiter Hotel is Good to me”
Reviews.Author: MemphisWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I, my sister, Bro-in-law, and friend stayed a total of 6 nights in two different rooms: one was a pair of doubles exactly the same, the 2nd was a semi-suite, with king bed and a comfortable sofa bed). The suite was in a new building that has been added recently to the original. Very large, beautiful bathroom. The double was small, but typical European room. The location is ideal. Breakfast was generous, if monotonous, and included w/ room price. Wi-Fi was supposed to be available in the rooms, but wasn't in the Dbl, was in the suite, was in the lobby. Alex, the manager, is a bit unfriendly in the beginning but warms up after a while if one is congenial. I asked him the nearest store where we might purchase an electric kettle, and he leant us one from the kitchen. Said he had bought 125 kettles for the 26 rooms and that there were only 6 left, the others having disappeared. He arranged taxi for us to the airport, and a taxi to the airport to pick us up from our return flight from Prague, much less expensively than was was posted on the internet (30 Euro for 2 persons, 35 Euro for 3). We paid 99 Euro for the dbl and 129 Euro for the suite, which easily accomodated 3 or 4 adults. After having paid 95 Euro for each of 2 nights in a B&B nearby that was the 3rd floor above the street with no lift and stairs that were ladders, I found the Jupiter Hotel to be delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Counting the days to leave.”
Reviews.Author: wildrovercheshire
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the owner denied being himself. I was left to find the "room "myself. I wish I hadn"t it was half the size of a prison cell and the ensuite bathroom stank of urine.. I tried to chat in a friendly manner to the reception but got a cold stonewall attitude of negativity and indifference. Breakfast was standard Dutch fare and was fine... When I asked for some orange juice the man said there was plenty of water in my room.... I was counting the days to leave the place.. No recreatianal room for guests to mingle for this reason I will never stay there again... I abhorred the whole caboodle and felt ripped off. That place was a vaccum cleaner ie, It ......

Reviews.Title: “suitable for young backpackers”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBrown
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely small - not always possible to walk aournd the bed/s and the rooms without ensuite facilities reminded me of a youth hostel or backpackers place. Nothing is really maintained (our shower was blocked, furniture broken) and there are not enough tables in reception for breakfast so you have to queue up. It is very basic accommodation. There is nowhere to sit apart from your tiny bedroom and reception is looked at 8pm. The memory is of the rude manager who obviously hates his job and has little time for those who have paid to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal Experience”
Reviews.Author: jaykay2211
Reviews.Content: I normally would not write a review with a mediocre experience but this was hands down the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The staff was not only unpleasant but literaly robbed me when I left to catch a flight. The manager of the hotel grabbed my arm and snatched a handful of Euros out of my hand (50 E in total) and told me that my entering the building is a threat and that all hotels in amsterdam charge "tenants-like-me[you]" extra. This was absurd. I am a non-smoker, 5'8" asian american college grad travelling on a budget but he knew i had no time to argue and chuckled when I threatened to call the police. This ruined my experience in this city, hopefully you won't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: christine d
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for just the 1 night-new years eve. It was in a lovely location-when we finally found it that is! Bedroom was quite small but very clean. Walls were very thin and everything could be heard from next room. Breakfast was good, cereal, breads,eggs, meats, cheese, fruit, salad, juices and hot drinks. We spent tne night in damn square and it was so loud but when we got back to the hotel, it was very quiet and beds were very soft and comfortable-they were that soft my husband roled off his onto the floor! (nothing to do with the alcohol consumed of course)! The location was great for the museums and park.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly and lied about the internet”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler2424
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel, the website said that the hotel has Internet. This was not the case when I got there. My husband was furious because he had to do some business while on our honeymoon. The staff was not helpful and would not let us cancel our reservation to stay at another hotel that did have Internet. Other than that it was a good value for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good price - nice location”
Reviews.Author: KathrynLynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February 2007, and the prices were really great. We payed 89 euros for a triple the first night (w/ 3 people), and 65 euros for a double the second night (w/ 2 people). I give this hotel 4 out of 5 BASED ON THE PRICE. It wasn't the most fantastic experience, but for the price it was definitely better than expected. LOCATION The location is very handy - you can walk to the museum district and there are loads of restaurants within a few minutes walk, and the neighborhood feels safe. The central station was about a 10 minute tram ride away. COMFORT The first night when we were in the triple room, the bed was pretty comfortable for a hotel bed. The second night, the bed was ridiculous, like a half-deflated airbed. So it will depend if you are lucky or not how comfy your bed is. The first night in the triple our bathroom and shower were very cramped. The bathroom in the double was much better, still small, but you could move in there. The walls of this hotel are pretty thin. if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs! EXTRAS + STAFF The staff were helpful, but not the most social sort, especially for amsterdam where people tend to be so friendly. They loaned me a hairdryer each morning, which was handy. The breakfast was very basic but decent - an assortment of cereals, some bread, cheese, jam, coffee, tea, orange juice. There is a computer down there off the lobby where you can use internet for free. Overall, the hotel seemed clean enough, the people nice enough, and the comfort tolerable enough for a weekend visit - plus the price was really incredible. If we go again, we'll probably try and check out some B&Bs earlier (they were all booked when we went), but I thought this place was pretty decent and would definitely consider it again when looking around.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: NewZealand-7
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here in January. Good location (on a main tramline), friendly staff - and other guests - small comfortable room. We thought it was good value for money in this location. The only negative is we think the bathroom needed a good clean - the toilet floor had a smell!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sanz
Reviews.Content: I'm a solo, female Australian traveller, aged 51. I found the Jupiter Hotel to be excellent value for money. It is located within walking distance from all the major tourist attractions but if you feel like catching a boat or tram instead, they're also available nearby. Great food is available at the pub/cafe literally around the corner, but it's only a short walk to all the English-speaking eateries on the other side of one of the main canals. Although the hotel rooms are very small, the beds are comfortable and the linen is clean. The showers are hot and the towels are replaced daily. Take your own soap, though, as it is not provided. The continental breakfast is substantial and they even have a toaster (a luxury in many budget European hotels!). There is a tiny elevator to save you from having to climb those steep Amsterdam-style stairs (an absolutely impossible feat with a suitcase) if you're not young or physically fit. The managers speak perfect English (and various other languages) and you only need ask for help and they will provide whatever is possible. This is a strictly non-smoking hotel throughout, but the managers have thoughtfully provided a lovely little seat near the front door of the hotel from where smokers can admire the quaint little garden! Overall, this place is very good value for money: a little gem of a place to stay in a quite expensive but very interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds! Great bathroom! Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Brilliantine
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Jupiter Hotel in October 2006 and we really liked it and felt we had picked the best hotel for our needs/budget. The location was great. There's a sign to it on the main road, which would've been handy if we'd seen it, but we arrived after dark. It's in a leafy quiet street only 5 minutes walk from the Leidesplein, a busy square full of tables and chairs and surrounded by cafes, restaurants and bars. It's also close to the trams, and a 5-10 minute walk from the Van Gogh museum. We walked to the Anne Frank House too which - if we hadn't stopped for shops, beers, lunch, a walk round the park, sun-basking and to take silly photos, would have been about a 30 minute walk, the other side of the city centre. The room was nice. Although small, it was clean, tidy, the tv worked, and the beds were possibly THE most comfortable I have ever slept in! The street was nice and quiet at night, even with the window open. The en suite bathroom was bright and spotless and looked absolutely brand new! Superb. Hair-dryer included. It had a shower, loo, basin & 2 towels per person. If I stayed there again I think I'd opt for a shared bathroom. We saw it across the hall and it was exactly the same as the en suite. I guess our room would have been a lot bigger without the bathroom and it would've saved a few pounds. We used both anyway to save time... The breakfast was really excellent - as much as you can eat, from different cereals, breads/toast, spreads, cheeses, boiled eggs, cold meats, juice, tea, coffee, fruit... and the restaurant was beautifully presented, with fresh flowers on all the tables. Brekky is 7.30-9.30. The lift is apparently new - and very small. If you are claustrophobic take the stairs! My only grumbles would be that the staff didn't seem too happy. I don't think either of them smiled the whole time we were there (although that might be because we woke them up at 2am when we couldn't get the key to work in the outside door! We were trying the wrong door...). Also, we thought there would be lockers to put our bags in after we checked out until we we'd had to go for our flight, but the only option was to leave them in reception with the owner keeping an eye on them... They were fine, however. Last grumble, no tea & coffee-making facilities in the rooms. I know this isn't important when it's free downstairs, but it's nice to have one while to you get ready! Overall, I'd stay there again. Although there are many cheaper places, we felt this was good value for money, in terms of location and facilities. We paid about 90 euros between us for a twin en suite room, including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: geo54
Reviews.Content: I would not book with this hotel in the future. Some things you should know about the place. The location is fine. Not ideal but okay to get around. The stairs are incredibly steep but I hear that is what to expect in Amsterdam. What I really did not like was that the reception only stays open until 9-10pm. Therefore, after that time there is no one at the front desk to help you. You cannot get any phone calls to your room after 9pm as well. So if you need any sort of assistance after 10pm you are out of luck!! As well, in the morning the cleaning staff are knocking at the door, trying to get in at 9am. That is too early in my opinion for staying in Amsterdam!! The room is too small but the private bathroom is okay. The sink is too small to wash your face in since you will get water everywhere. Was not able to enjoy the breakfast since it was only served from 7-9am. The front desk staff were not very approachable. They would help briefly but it did not seem as though they really wanted to help. I would say there are much better places to stay in while visiting Amsterdam. Choose another hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my stay”
Reviews.Author: galsolo
Reviews.Content: Jupiter Hotel was a perfect home base for my 3-day stay in Amsterdam. Located on a quiet street, it was within easy walking distance of Leidseplein (tram stop loaded with cafes, bars and restaurants), Vondelpark, and the museum square. My single room was quite small, but that's to be expected in a 2-star hotel in Europe. The bathroom was a good size with a great shower. As for the breakfast, there were boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, fruit, mini-croissants, cereal, and a few types of bread (including multi-grain) - hardly a disappointment in my opinion. I found the owners to be helpful and appreciated the internet access in the lobby. I would definitely consider Hotel Jupiter for a future trip to Amsterdam - had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Rather expensive for poor standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Great location near Leidseplein. Tram-, Busstation arround the corner. -Pet friendly -Elevator -Quiet street, good situated inhabitants arround. -Tapas bar and italian restaurant near by. Supermarkets, etc. just arround the corner -Vondelpark at 300m distance Cons: -Lousy breakfast: No wholemeal bread or cereals, industrial marmelade, cheese and cold cuts. No organic products. Sugar and fat en masse. No variety, every day the same junk food (for a room price of 94 â‚¬ !!) Poor start for an exausting tourist day in amsterdam. - Very hot under the roof (eg. 28Â°C outside, 40 Â°C inside !!!), no air outlet and no door handle or lock in the bathroom. Window defective, couldnÂ´t be closed. - Lazy and slow room cleaning service. - Unfriendly hotelier, (rest of the staff was nice). - No smoking - Poor safety, backdoor left open several times, no safety locks for hotel rooms. - Expensive, concerning the poor standard. True Amsterdamertjes who offer little and demand a lot only for living in a popular city. In Germany you would have payed half the price for a higher standard even in the capital.

Reviews.Title: “they even found us a place to park our SUV”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Alex and Ima were perfect hosts. breakfast was great. out of all the places we stayed in Europe the Jupiter was the best. This hotel has been gone through with new everything from the beautiful flower arrangements that Ima arranges daily to the showers to the drywall and the new elevator. great location to the Centrum area and transportation. beds were very good air conditioning too. Hope to go back to Amsterdam and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: TheJandals
Reviews.Content: Did the other reviewers actually stay at the same hotel that I did? The only good thing I can about the hotel is its location as it is really close to the Leidseplein. The shared facilities were filthy when we got there. It did not look as though the toilet (or the floor) had been cleaned for a month. The facilities were not cleaned until 3 days after we got there. It was disgusting. Staff were rude to us when we complained so we left a night early and they refused to give us a refund for our last night. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: caitlinette
Reviews.Content: Definitely clean, bright, cheery. Walking into this place is cool -- it feels like you're going into someone's house. Plus, if you have a room that overlooks the backyard, you'll see that the view is of many backyards -- the neighbors'. I was excited about this because you can see people gardening, out on the deck, having dinner, like what regular Dutch people do. It was very serene and peaceful up there. I often sat at the window at sunset and wrote in my journal. Being an American, the strange Dutch window was impossible to open! It slanted out at the top, making only a small crack for air to flow in through, but finally I learned how to shut it and push it open fully so that it swung out. The bathroom was spacious and sparkling clean, and the elevator gave us no trouble. The owner was a little distant and aloof. This hotel is close to Leidseplein. It's about a 4 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayeds
Reviews.Content: I researched quite a few hotels in Amsterdam before booking the Jupiter and seeing the positive comments on this website helped with that. I was looking for a Hotel in a quiet location and also a reasonable price. The room was clean and tidy and we also had a shower / toilet which was a good size and very clean with nice tiling around the walls. Great breakfast with a wide choice and you can help yourself to as much as you want. The Hotel is located on a quiet street and there was no street noise at night or in the morning (and we had a room at the front of the Hotel). Within easy walk of the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, Vondelpark and on the first morning we walked from the Hotel down Leidseplein and on to Dam Square and around Amsterdam. I would have no problem staying at the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “jupiter-just the ticket!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from 3 night stay at the jupiter. wasnt sure what to expect as it only had 2 star rating. we found the hotel clean, comfortable and friendly service. we had a ground floor room and we understand the hotel is undergoing some refurbs! but our view was of a builders yard!! however the double room was quite spacious, had a lovely clean new bathroom. the hotel offered a nice filling breakfast of cheese, cold meats, cereal, rolls- the lot basically! the best thing about the jupiter was the location, just a short walk to the leidesplein, museums and round the corner from the vondelpark. i would recomend this hotel- its cheap but friendly, clean and in a great location. dont be put off by the 2 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “great place to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the jupiter in nov 03 and i am planning a trip back to amsterdam in nov 04, and will be staying at the same hotel. I found the hotel to be a great base for exploring the city, and although the bathroom was a little small, the bedroom was huge! Only a 5 min walk and youre in the leidesplein where you can catch a tram to virtually anywhere in the city, or you can stay in the area and check out the bars, restaurants and coffee houses in the area. I give it a huge thumbs up and urge you to give it a try..its not the hilton but who needs the hilton when you have weed???

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean & affordable place to stay , good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and like affordable, clean hotels that offer me what I need, instead of making me pay for what I do not use. This hotel offers bed and breakfast, and is in the center of all attractions in Amsterdam. Yes, it is NOT in the HISTORICAL center of Amsterdam, but the major outgoing areas, the musea and concert hall, and all that I like a city for, are within walking distance. Despite of what I just read in another review, This hotel DOES have an elevator. I had a clean room, nice bed and a very complete European breakfast (buffet). Cerials, milk, oj, coffe, tea, 3 or 4 kinds of meat, cheese, sweet stuff, different kinds of bread, eggs etc.. Yep, NOT an American breakfast , but we're in this IS Europe. It is ran and owned by a family, and I really enjoyed their hospiltality and my stay. The stairs are steep, but that is normal in all original buildings in Amsterdam. And the rooms are not too big, but not too small eather. Good value for money. I do definetely recommend this. Ulli

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay -- far better than a hostel and about the same price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a five-night stay at the Jupiter, staying in a triple room with two other friends, and we had a wonderful time... I think that visitors have to go in knowing that this is a two-star hotel (i.e. no room service, etc. essentially a clean, comfortable place to stay) to be able to enjoy the amenities the hotel has to offer. The hotel is fairly small, and taken care of by an accordingly small though very kind and accomodating staff. Not sure how many floors there are in the place, maybe three or four including the ground floor, but there are about three rooms per floor. Our triple room was about 15-17 m2 containing two single beds and a queen, so it comfortably accomodated three people, and could do four if the queen is shared. The room had the essential private bathroom, television (which in Amsterdam means all kinds of international stations, though it might have been cable, I'm not sure...) closet, mirror, table and chairs, and a safe. Not the Ritz by far, but very comfortable, cozy, and clean. The bathroom is according fairly standard and small, equipped with complimentary soap and towels and things, and the shower (at least in our room) is very much integrated into the bathroom meaning that there is no curtain. Just have to make sure you don't point the removable showerhead everywhere in order to keep the rest of the bathroom dry. The stairs in the place are indeed very steep, though by what I could tell from the rest of Amsterdam, it's not all that rare and is a space-saving mechanism. So I would probably not advise this particular hotel to anyone who might have physical difficulties or disabilities, or who otherwise might have problems traversing steep stairs. A sit-down buffet breakfast is included in the room price, and again it's not a five-star meal, but it's complete and free! (well, included...) Coffee, teas, juices, cereals, bread and cold cuts, etc. Quite nice... Geography-wise, it's not in the center of the city, so it does take a little walking, but Amsterdam is relatively very dense so traveling (either by walking or taking the trams and buses) from the hotel to nearly any other point in Amsterdam is quite easy. In fact, it's sort of the best of both worlds in that it's in a quite residential street, but walking distance to more commercial areas. And it's about a 20-25 minute tram ride from Central Station. What I really enjoyed about the hotel is that my friends and I were originally planning on staying in a hostel, and in the end when we divided the price of our triple room, it ended up being about the same price per person as a hostel would have been, and we had tons more at our disposible than we ever would have had in a hostel (private bathroom, private ROOM, breakfast included, towels, general cleanliness, etc.) So in all, we had a great stay -- definitely recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Jupiter Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2e Helmersstraat 14, Amsterdam 1054 CJ, The Netherlands
